hint.title: Tip #1: How do I get Snackr out of my way?
hint.description:
There are a few ways to get Snackr out of the way:

  • Right-click or ctrl-click on the ticker, or click the collapse arrow button on the tab, to collapse it. Click the collapse button again to uncollapse
  • "Toss" Snackr to a different side of the screen or onto another monitor by dragging it a little ways and letting go. You can also set this manually in the Preferences tab of the Options popup.
  • In the Preferences tab of the Options popup, turn off "always on top".

hint.title: Tip #2: How come I'm not seeing some items from my feeds?
hint.description:
There are a few reasons why you might not see items:

  • By default, Snackr doesn't show items older than 30 days ago. You can adjust this in the Preferences tab of the Options popup.
  • Once you read an item, it never shows up again.
  • Snackr shows unread items from a given feed in reverse order. If you don't read an item, it will eventually cycle back around.
  • There might be a bug! If you feel like you're never seeing items from a feed, send the feed URL to me and I'll take a look at it.

hint.title: Tip #3: How can I quickly add a feed?
hint.description:
There are several ways to add a feed:

  • From Firefox on Windows, you can set Snackr as your main RSS feed reader. Click on a feed icon on a website, then from the dropdown at the top, choose "Choose Application...", and browse to the Snackr application in Program Files. From then on, when you hit Subscribe, Snackr will automatically add the feed. You can also check the "Always use Snackr to subscribe to feeds" to make Firefox add feeds to Snackr as soon as you click on a feed icon. (Unfortunately, Firefox on Mac doesn't seem to support this workflow properly at the moment.)
  • If you're mouse-oriented, copy the site or feed URL to the clipboard, then click the + button on the feed ticker. (Snackr will auto-discover feeds from websites if they have autodiscovery set up.)
  • If you're keyboard-oriented, copy the URL, Alt-Tab/Cmd-Tab to the Snackr window, then hit Ctrl-V/Cmd-V to paste the feed.
